intro: Tetranthera dealbata, commonly known as the white-stemmed tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
